Question: This person's character, Steven Gold, a failing medical student trying to break into stand-up, was somewhat edgy and complex.
Hints: Later that year, this person starred in the Disney/Pixar animated blockbuster, Toy Story, as the voice of the toy Sheriff Woody.
The film opened on December 21, 2007, and this person received a Golden Globe nomination.
About a week later, this person apologized for the remark, saying that nothing is more American than voting one's conscience.
